original_title: Trump tariff of 30-pct for EU and Mexico, India said to expect below 20-pct
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – US President Donald Trump has charged 30 percent tariffs from the European Union and Mexico, in tariff letters posted on his social media platform amid a report that India is expecting a rate below 20 percent.
Trump said Mexico has not done enough to stop cartels from turning the US into a ‘Narco Trafficking Playground.’
“Mexico has been helping me secure the border, BUT, what Mexico has done, is not enough,” he said.
The EU letter contained his standard language, that there is a trade deficit, which the EU has done little to correct.
The US trade deficit is a result of foreign investments made in the country, including by EU countries like Germany.
He threatened further tariffs against the EU if it tried to retaliate. Trump had separately struck a 10 percent deal with the UK.
India is expecting a rate below 20 percent, Bloomberg Newswires reported, citing sources familiar with the matter.
Sri Lanka’s apparel exporters had also warned earlier that India may get a rate below its current 26 percent. (Colombo/July12/2025)
